content:
From: Kevin Kappelmann <kevin.kappelmann@tum.de>
Hi all,

The Isabelle website (e.g. isabelle.in.tum.de) includes a link to the
"repository version". It redirects to
"isabelle-dev.sketis.net/source/isabelle", which hides the actual
content behind a login. I suggest changing the link to some source
without a login, e.g. "https://isabelle.in.tum.de/repos/isabelle/".

Best wishes,

Kevin

From: Kevin Kappelmann via isabelle-dev <isabelle-dev@mailman.proof.cit.tum.de>
I just wanted to bump this thread: would it be possible to change the
link to the repository version to some source that does not require a login?

Best wishes,

Kevin

On 24/09/2025 13:49, Kevin Kappelmann via isabelle-dev wrote:
I just wanted to bump this thread: would it be possible to change the link to
the repository version to some source that does not require a login?

The time to update the website is usually before the next release, i.e. in a
few weeks.

It also requires some thoughts, because
https://isabelle.in.tum.de/repos/isabelle has performance problems, too.
De-facto we have been using https://isabelle.sketis.net/repos/isabelle recently.

An alternative is to stop all this AI-nonsense out there ...

Makarius

From: Tobias Nipkow <nipkow@in.tum.de>
Makarius,

Please show the link to the TUM repository with the new release. It has
performance problems at times (and you can always add a warning), but that is
much less of a hurdle than needing a login. Of course you can show both.

Tobias
